alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 21 at 7:54PM MDT until June 21 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 1000 PM MDT. * At 753 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Steins. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by I-10 road cameras. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 28. Locations impacted include... Lordsburg, Steins, Cotton City, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Pyramid Mountains and Shakespeare. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
